description.narrative: Accra Medical Centre Limited, Ghana (AMC) is an integrated healthcare services provider seeing individuals and corporate clients within the Greater Accra and Western Regions of Ghana since 2012, and attending to over 90,000 patients in 2020. As part of its vision, it started the greenfield construction of a modern specialist hospital in Accra in 2019, which currently has 45 beds. The Project is the Phase 1 optimization of AMCs medical services by adding an additional 15 bed maternity ward to the newly built specialist hospital in Accra, offer 24- hour specialist services and a full spectrum of medical diagnostics and surgical services, an acquisition of the strategic Accra annex site to support the new hospital, the expansion to Takoradi to open a 15-bed hospital to serve patients within the Western Region of Ghana, and the optimization of AMCs financing structure with long term financing that will mirror the cashflow realities of the project.

IFC expects the Project to increase the delivery of high-quality healthcare services in Ghana. The project will do this by supporting the development of the new facilities. This will directly benefit patients in Accra and Takoradi and the larger community through the provision of enhanced specialist care, and contribute to the markets development. The concessional rate for the cost of capital will accord AMC the ability to reduce service charges and/or introduce discount pricing to untapped segments of the market which could result in an expansion of AMCs outreach to a larger populace.
The funding will result in the provision of the following additional services at AMC Accra: (1) Obstetrics & Gyanaecology Services; (2) Neo-natal Intensive Care Unit ; (3) Intensive Care Unit /High Dependency Unit Services, and (4) Specialist Surgical Services. Access to critical care and emergency care services to help improve the capacity and quality of critical care services
AMC Takoradi will be an ultra-modern 15 bed Physician Specialist and Medical Diagnostic Centre and expected to serve the Sekondi-Takoradi Community thereby helping to fill the void to accessible, affordable and reliable customer-oriented healthcare services within the Sekondi-Takoradi Metropolis.
